title: How do 18th-19th century sailors take a bath after months at sea? - Quora

response.answer_text: If they did wash, it was in salt water pumped up from the sea by sailors manning a pump and hose system, because freshwater was too precious to use for anything other than drinking or cooking. And I'm presuming they did do it occasionally because it's mentioned in one of the CS Forester books about the Royal Navy in the 19th century.
